review_text: My Grandfather, Robert Selby, is buried here. I visited only once, in 1999. I was very moved after reading the comments of local people and local school children in the visitor's book. Dutch people living near the cemetery have taken care and respected the graves and sacrifices of these foreign soldiers for the last 75 years. Thank you.

Beautifully kept war cemetery and a credit to the local community. I would drop in here on my rides between Eindhoven and Helmond, read the family stories of desperately young soldiers lost too soon, when the tears welled I'd be on my way. A random reminder of how fortunate the following generations have been and a warning for generations to come. 'Love your neighbor as yourself.' There is no commandment greater than these.

Very well kept cemetery, highly recommend if you have an interest in world war II. Being Irish, I found two soldier's graves who were from O'Briensbridge Co Clare (Michael McGrath) and from Mullingar Co Westmeath (Thomas Joseph O'Brien).
Beautifully kept and peaceful place. Remembering the fallen in our hearts.

My husband uncle Colin
Reid  resting place beautiful spiritual was a promise kept visited the heros war cemetery twice
Very nicely arranged cemetery.  In addition to the cemetery there is also a talking board with information about World War II. in the area.
Serene peace, while being really well kept.

Ein wunderschönes Kriegsfriedhof.
Dort liegen britische Soldaten aus dem 2 Weltkrieg.
Er ist sehr gepflegt und sauber.
Ein Besuch lohnt sich.
Einfach wunderschön gemacht
